doc.after: The masked shrike is the smallest of its genus, a slender bird which usually weighs 20â23Â g (0.71â0.81Â oz), measuring 17â18.5Â cm (6.7â7.3Â in) long with a 24â26.5Â cm (9.4â10.4Â in) wingspan. It has a long tail and relatively small bill,[3][11] on each side of which is a tomial tooth; the upper mandible bears a triangular ridge which fits a corresponding notch in the lower mandible.
